node.title: Latest round of MIQ room releases postponed 24 hours over Omicron fears
node.description: The delay was so the Government could "carefully manage capacity as more travellers spend longer in MIQ", officials say.
node.content: ["The latest round of managed isolation (MIQ) room releases has been postponed for 24 hours due to the Omicron situation.\n", "It was scheduled for Tuesday but will take place at midday on Wednesday, with the lobby opening at 11am.", "The delay was so the Government could \"carefully manage capacity as more travellers spend longer in MIQ, reducing availability\", a Twitter post from the Ministry of Business, Innovation and Employment said.", "New Zealand has a total of 22 COVID-19 cases with the Omicron variant in international arrivals.", "The World Health Organization has urged people to cancel some of their holiday plans to protect public health as the Omicron variant spreads globally. The Government will provide an update at 2pm on its COVID-19 response in light of the Omicron variant spreading around the world, including possible changes to the border reopening.", "Ministers had been due to meet in early January to discuss the border reopening, but it is understood there will be a further update on Tuesday.", "On Monday Cabinet ministers also considered advice on whether to shorten the time between the second and booster doses of the COVID-19 vaccine, and on the strengthening of MIQ. COVID-19 Response Minister Chris Hipkins is also expected to give an update on the vaccination of children aged 5 to 11.", "RNZ"]
